# planetscale_cidrs (Resource)

Cidrs Resource

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "planetscale_cidrs" "my_cidrs" {
  cidrs = [
    "..."
  ]
  database_name = "...my_database_name..."
  organization  = "...my_organization..."
  role          = "...my_role..."
  schema        = "...my_schema..."
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `cidrs` (List of String) List of IPv4 CIDR ranges (e.g., ['192.168.1.0/24', '192.168.1.1/32']). Must contain at least one valid IPv4 address or range.
- `database_name` (String) The name of the database
- `organization` (String) The name of the organization the database belongs to

### Optional

- `role` (String) The PostgreSQL role to restrict access to. Leave empty or omit to allow access for all roles.
- `schema` (String) The PostgreSQL schema to restrict access to. Leave empty or omit to allow access to all schemas.

### Read-Only

- `actor` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--actor))
- `created_at` (String) When the entry was created
- `deleted_at` (String) When the entry was deleted
- `id` (String) The ID of the IP allowlist entry
- `updated_at` (String) When the entry was updated

<a id="nestedatt--actor"></a>
### Nested Schema for `actor`

Read-Only:

- `avatar_url` (String) The URL of the actor's avatar
- `display_name` (String) The name of the actor
- `id` (String) The ID of the actor

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `id` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = planetscale_cidrs.my_planetscale_cidrs
  id = jsonencode({
    database_name = "..."
    id = "..."
    organization = "..."
  })
}
```

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
terraform import planetscale_cidrs.my_planetscale_cidrs '{"database_name": "...", "id": "...", "organization": "..."}'
```
